abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Transmigration Project will
            settle 3,500 families at Muara Wahau and 2,500 families at
            Sangkulirang in East Kalimantan. Each family will receive a
            3.5 ha farm and a standard transmigration package including
            1.25 ha of cleared land for houselots and food crops,
            transportation to the site, a house, agricultural inputs and
            subsistence supplies. Each family with assistance from
            public from public estates will also establish 2.0 ha of
            coconut. About 500 ha of coconut will be established by a
            public estate at Muara Wahau. As both sites are forested,
            commercially valuable timber will be recovered during land
            clearing. The major risks associated with the project are
            poor coordination of implementation and reduced crop yields
            due to poor soil quality.

The Fourth Transmigration Project will
            settle 3,500 families at Muara Wahau and 2,500 families at
            Sangkulirang in East Kalimantan. Each family will receive a
